title: Do All Dogs Go To Heaven? Christians React To Pope's Comment
teaser: Pope Francis said "paradise is open to all God's creatures." It was apparently an attempt to cheer up a child whose dog had died.
contentencoded:
At a public appearance on St. Peter’s Square on Wednesday, Pope Francis said “paradise is open to all God’s creatures.”

It was apparently an attempt to cheer up a child whose dog had died. But he also, according to Italian media, cited passages of the Bible that refer to animals going to heaven.Â This provoked quite a reaction across the Christian world.

Christine Gutleben, senior director of faith outreach at the Humane Society of the United States, discusses the pope’s comments and whether they could have an impact outside religion on animal rights or protections.

Guest

  • Christine Gutleben, senior director of faith outreach at the Humane Society of the United States.
